call_title: UX challenges in web3 | Big Pampa | ErgoHack 9

topics.title: Introduction and Speaker Background
topics.summary: Nico introduces himself as founder of BigPampa design agency and outlines the presentation on UX challenges in Web3. He explains the talk will cover why UX is important for dApps and provide actionable solutions for builders.

topics.title: UX as Key to Web3 Mass Adoption
topics.summary: Explains how poor UX in blockchain products prevents mass adoption and why people only use products they enjoy. Introduces five UX challenges that will be analyzed with practical solutions for builders.

topics.title: Challenge 1: Decision Fatigue Solutions
topics.summary: Discusses how Web3 amplifies decision fatigue through complex choices about blockchains, wallets, and protocols with high financial risks. Provides five practical solutions including predefined settings, recommendations, and contextual information display.

topics.title: Challenge 2: New User Roles in Web3
topics.summary: Explains how Web3 users assume multiple new roles including asset custody, governance participation, and legal compliance. Suggests designing complete user journeys that integrate these roles seamlessly into products.

topics.title: Challenge 3: Poor Communication Patterns
topics.summary: Identifies communication problems including technical jargon, lack of feedback, and information overload. Provides solutions like avoiding jargon, implementing optimistic UI, showing transaction states, and adding human personality to interfaces.

topics.title: Challenge 4: Tech-First vs User-First Approach
topics.summary: Critiques technology-driven development that ignores user needs and leads to product failure. Advocates for user-first approach, early design team involvement, UX research, and focusing on real problem-solving rather than blockchain buzzwords.

topics.title: Challenge 5: Breaking Technological Constraints
topics.summary: Encourages questioning accepted blockchain practices that harm user experience and finding innovative workarounds. Suggests building new best practices like embedded test transactions and security features for unknown smart contracts.

topics.title: Mass Adoption Responsibility and Conclusion
topics.summary: Warns about increased responsibility as UX improves and more users join, referencing Luna as example of accessible products causing widespread losses. Calls for founders to adopt user-centered thinking and users to demand better UX standards.
